body.p: The AI Translator add-on is a powerful Oxygen XML Editor extension that provides AI-powered translation capabilities for XLIFF (XML Localization Interchange File Format) files. This add-on streamlines the translation workflow by leveraging advanced AI models to produce high-quality translations while maintaining the structural integrity of your XML content.

section.title: What is a Translation Task?
section.p: When working with the AI Translator add-on, a translation task represents a complete translation workflow that leverages the AI connectors and models configured in the Oxygen AI Positron to translate XLIFF translation units. Each task operates on specific XLIFF files and applies the selected AI translation configuration to process the content systematically.

ul.li: AI-Powered Translation - Translation tasks utilize the AI connectors and models defined in the Oxygen AI Positron, ensuring consistent configuration across Oxygen tools. This integration provides access to various AI engines with the flexibility to choose the most appropriate model for your translation requirements.

Quality Assurance through Introspection - Each translation task includes a built-in introspection mechanism that verifies the accuracy and quality of translations. This quality control system analyzes translated content to ensure it maintains the integrity of the original formatting and structure.

Retry Translation System - When introspection identifies potential issues with a translation, the system can automatically initiate additional translation attempts using different models. This progressive approach allows the use of more powerful models to ensure optimal translation quality.
Parallel Task Execution - The add-on supports running multiple translation tasks simultaneously, enabling improved productivity and faster processing of large translation projects.

Configurable Translation Settings - Translation configurations are fully editable through the preferences interface, allowing you to customize AI models, retry strategies, and introspection parameters.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: The Oxygen AI Positron add-on must be installed for the AI Translator to function properly. The AI connectors defined in Oxygen AI Positron can also be used for AI translations, providing a unified configuration experience across Oxygen tools.

body.p: The AI Translator view is the main interface for managing translation tasks in Oxygen XML Editor. This view provides a comprehensive task management system that allows you to create, monitor, and control translation jobs with real-time status updates and detailed progress tracking.

section.title: Interface Overview
section.p: The AI Translator View consists of several key components:

ul.li: New task button - Creates a new translation task.

Settings drop-down - Provides access to the following options:
Preferences... - Opens the preferences dialog box.
Clear cache - Clears the translation cache.

dd.p:
The main panel displays all translation tasks with the following information for each task:
Task Name - Descriptive name of the translation job.
Progress Bar - Visual indicator that shows the completion percentage and current file being processed.
Status Badge - Color-coded status indicator (Queued, Running, Stopped, Completed).
Task Details - Creation date, progress information, and duration.
Action Buttons:
Resume/Stop task - Runs or stops the task execution.
Delete task - Removes the task from the list.
Save translated XLIFF - This button appears only for tasks with Completed status. Saves the current translation work as an XLIFF file on your computer.
Task contextual menu:
Resume/Stop task - Runs or stops the task execution.
Delete task - Removes the task from the list.
Duplicate task - Create a new task with the same information: user instructions, translation memory, XLIFF files, and the AI model configuration used.
Retry failed translations - This contextual action appears only for tasks with Completed status. It lets you create a new task with different settings and instructions to retry translating the failed parts.
Save log file - The action allows you to save a log file with detailed information about the task execution, current status, and any problems encountered.
Save translated XLIFF - This contextual action appears only for tasks with Completed status. Saves the current translation work as an XLIFF file on your computer.
Save intermediate translated XLIFF - This action is available only for tasks with a status of Stopped or Failed when some parts have already been translated. It allows you to save the current translation progress as an XLIFF file on your computer.

section.title: Task Status States
section.p: Translation tasks progress through various states during their lifecycle:

ul.li:
Queued - Task is created and waiting to be processed.
Shows the creation timestamp.
Task is in the processing queue.

Running - Task is actively being processed.
Displays real-time progress (e.g. "15/400 translation units").
Shows the current file being processed.
Provides the estimated time remaining.
Updates the elapsed processing time.

Stopped- Task has been paused or interrupted.
Shows the last update timestamp.
Can be resumed using the play button.
Preserves the current progress.

Completed - Task has finished successfully.
Shows the completion timestamp and total duration.
Displays the final statistics (e.g. "400/400 translation units").
Task remains in the history for reference purposes.

section.title: Notification System
section.p: The right side of the interface shows real-time notifications for task events:

ul.li: Task Creation - Confirms when a new translation task is created.
Task Progress - Updates regarding translation progress and file processing.
Task Completion - Notification when tasks finish with summary statistics.
Time Tracking - Detailed timing information including start time, elapsed time, and total duration.

section.title: Task Management Features
section.p: The comprehensive task management system ensures efficient handling of translation workflows while providing full visibility into the translation process.

ul.li: Real-time progress bars that show the completion percentage.
The current file being processed.
The translation units completed vs. total.
The estimated time remaining for running tasks.
Start, pause, and resume individual tasks.
Delete completed or unwanted tasks.
Queue multiple tasks for sequential processing.
Visual status indicators for quick task state identification.
Detailed progress information for each task.
Historical record of completed tasks with performance metrics.

section.title: Caching Mechanism
section.p: The AI Translator add-on includes a caching system that stores AI translation responses locally to optimize performance, reduce costs, and improve the overall translation experience.

ul.li: Cost Reduction - By caching AI engine responses, the system significantly reduces API calls to external services such as OpenAI, resulting in lower usage costs for repeated translation requests.
Performance Improvement - Cached translations are retrieved instantly from local storage, eliminating network latency and API response times for previously translated content.
Consistency - The caching mechanism ensures that identical translation requests always return the same results, providing consistent and reproducible translations across multiple runs.

section.title: Enabling and Configuring Caching
section.p:
The caching configuration is managed through the AI Translator preferences dialog box. You can access preferences using the following methods:
From the AI Translator view - Select Preferences from the Settings drop-down.
From the Oxygen menu - Go to Options Preferences Plugins AI Translator .

section.title: Clearing the Cache
section.p: You can clear the cache from the AI Translator view by using the Clear Cache button from the Settings drop-down.
Clearing cache might be useful after significant changes to AI model configurations or when experiencing inconsistent translation results.

body.p: To create a new translation task in the AI Translator:

ol.li: Open the AI Translator view (go to Window Show View AI Translator if it is not visible).
Click the New button in the AI Translator toolbar to open the New translation task dialog box.

Configure the task settings:
Name - Enter a descriptive name for your translation task (e.g. flowers.dita â€” fr-FR).
Configuration - Select your AI translation configuration from the drop-down menu (e.g. "Translate with OpenAI").
Details - Provide additional context in the details field to refine translations. You can describe the scope, target audience, or preferred style to help the AI engine produce more accurate translations.

Specify files:
XLIFF file - Browse and select the XLIFF file you want to translate (e.g. /path/to/translation/file.xliff).
Memory file - Optionally, specify a translation memory file (TMX format) to improve translation consistency (e.g. /path/to/memory/file.tmx).
Click the Create button to start the translation process, or Cancel to abort.

body.p: Once created, your translation task will appear in the AI Translator view with status indicators that show the progress (Running, Stopped, or Completed) and processing time information.

The AI Translator add-on provides comprehensive configuration options through the Preferences dialog box, allowing you to customize translation behavior, AI model settings, caching, and retry mechanisms.

You can access preferences using the following methods:
From the AI Translator view - Select Preferences from the Settings drop-down.
From the Oxygen menu - Go to Options Preferences Plugins AI Translator .

section.title: Main Preferences Panel
section.p: The main preferences panel contains the core settings for the AI Translator:

ul.li: Displays general information about the AI Translator.
Shows that it helps translate XLIFF files using AI engines.
Notes the requirement for the Oxygen AI Positron to define AI engine connectors.
Path - /home/user/translations (configurable).
Purpose - Internal working folder used by the translator to store intermediate results.
Important - This folder is not meant for direct browsing or manual editing.
Configuration - Use the browse button to select a different location.
Checkbox - Enable/disable local caching of AI engine responses.
Benefit - When enabled, messages exchanged with AI engines are cached locally for reuse and faster translations.

Storage Settings:
Size on disk (MB) - Default 100 MB - configurable cache size limit.
Time-to-live/Expiration (days) - Cache entry expiration time (default is 7 days).
Drop-down Options - 3, 5, 7, 15, 31, 90, 180, 365 days.
Cache Behavior - A cache entry expires after the configured time-to-live period.
Checkbox - Toggle to enable/disable the caching system.
Default - Enabled (recommended for optimal performance).
Setting - Configure maximum cache size in MB.
Default - 100 MB.
Range - Adjustable based on available disk space and translation volume.
Recommendation - Set to 100-500 MB for typical usage, higher for large-scale translation projects.
Setting - Configure cache entry expiration time.
Default - 7 days/
Recommendation - 7-15 days for active projects, longer periods for reference translations.

section.title: Translation Configurations
section.p: The configurations table manages various AI translation setups:

ul.li: Name - Descriptive name for the configuration (e.g. "Translate with Open AI GPT 4.1").
Positron Connector Type - The AI connector type (e.g. "Open AI").
Translation Model - The specific AI model (e.g. "GPT 4.1", "GPT 5").
Translate with Open AI GPT 4.1 - Uses OpenAI connector with GPT 4.1 model.
Translate with Open AI GPT 5 - Uses OpenAI connector with GPT 5 model.
Add - Create a new translation configuration.
Edit - Modify an existing configuration.
Delete - Remove a configuration.

body.p: When creating or editing a translation configuration, the detailed configuration dialog box provides comprehensive options for fine-tuning translation behavior.

ul.li: Configuration name - Custom name for the configuration (e.g. "Translate with Open AI").
Positron connector - Select the AI connector type from dropdown (e.g. "Open AI").
Translation model - Choose the specific AI model (e.g. "GPT 4.1").

section.title: Introspection and Retries
section.p: Configure quality checks and retry behavior when translations fail integrity validation:

ul.li: Enable introspection & retries - Master toggle for quality control features.

Enable introspection only for complex translation units:
When this option is selected, introspections is performed only for translation units with complex inline structures.
When unselected, introspection is performed on every translation unit.
Introspection model - The AI model used for quality checks (e.g. "GPT 4.1").
Max translation retries - The maximum number of retry attempts (default: 3).

section.title: Retry Models Configuration

ul.li: Retries models - Comma-separated list of models used sequentially for retries.
Example - "GPT 4.1, GPT 4.1 Mini, GPT 5".
Choose button - Opens the Select Retries Models dialog box.

section.p: This dialog box allows you to configure the sequence of models used when retry attempts are needed:

ul.li: 1st retry - First model to try (e.g. "GPT 4.1").
2nd retry - Second model to try (e.g. "GPT 4.1").
3rd retry - Third model to try (e.g. "GPT 5").
Choose a location with sufficient disk space for translation files.
Ensure the folder has write permissions.
Consider using a dedicated folder for translation work.
Enable caching for faster repeat translations and reduced API costs.
Set a size limit based on available disk space and translation volume.
Balance the expiration time between freshness and reuse (7-15 days recommended).
Choose the Primary model based on translation quality requirements and cost considerations.
Configure a mix of Retry models for fallback scenarios.
Use Introspection for complex documents that require a high level of accuracy.

section.title: Retry Strategy

ul.li: A number of 3 max retries is typically sufficient for most scenarios.
For the model sequence, start with cost-effective models, then escalate to premium models for retries.
Enable complex units only for documents with complex inline formatting.

section.p: This configuration system provides flexibility to optimize translation quality, performance, and cost based on your specific requirements and available AI models.
